# Hyperfy Platform Development Updates

Hyperfy is actively developing its virtual world platform with several key technical advancements and ongoing discussions about platform capabilities.

## Technical Features and Development

- **Screensharing functionality** is being tested in the development environment, including a demonstration of "world inception" where worlds were nested within each other
- **V2 platform features** include a new file handling system allowing custom app mappings for different file types (similar to OS file associations)
- **Server infrastructure** using Coolify + Hetzner (~$50/month) could handle 30-40 worlds
- **Electron prototyping** is underway to potentially allow Hyperfy worlds to be built as standalone apps with better performance than web versions
- **Programming support** appears to be available for Python with Java support coming soon (though context is limited)

## Mobile and VR Development

- **Mobile usability** is being discussed, with some users advocating for prioritizing the mobile experience due to the large global mobile gaming market
- **Technical limitations** for mobile include webGL performance issues compared to native apps
- **Missing mobile and VR controls** are planned to be rolled out soon
- **PWA (Progressive Web Apps)** are being considered as a potential solution for caching assets on mobile

## Community Development

- Community members are working on various features including **combat mechanics** like target lock
- **Development workflows** using Cursor AI for app creation are being shared among users
- **V1 to V2 compatibility issues** exist, with assets potentially needing preparation work in Blender using the Hyperfy Tools add-on

## Learning Resources

- **Blender tutorials** are available, with upcoming sessions mentioned as alternatives to the standard "donut tutorial"
- Users are sharing **AI-assisted development workflows** using Cursor, including context setup strategies

# Hyperfy Platform Development Updates

Hyperfy is actively developing its virtual world platform with several key technical advancements and ongoing discussions about platform capabilities.

## Technical Features

- **Screensharing functionality** is being tested in the development environment, including a demonstration of "world inception" where worlds were nested within each other
- **V2 platform features** include a new file handling system allowing custom app mappings for different file types (similar to OS file associations)
- **Server infrastructure** using Coolify + Hetzner (~$50/month) could handle 30-40 worlds
- **Mobile and VR controls** are planned to be rolled out soon, though analytics show these users are currently in the minority
- **Electron prototyping** is underway to potentially allow Hyperfy worlds to be built as standalone apps with better performance
- **PWA (Progressive Web Apps)** are being considered for asset caching to improve mobile performance

## Development Workflows

- Developers are using **Cursor AI** for app creation, with users sharing context setup strategies
- Community members are working on features like **combat mechanics** and **target lock**
- There are **compatibility issues between v1 and v2 builds**, with assets potentially needing preparation work in Blender using the Hyperfy Tools add-on

## Mobile Experience

- Discussions about prioritizing mobile experience, with some users advocating for better mobile controls
- Technical limitations noted regarding mobile performance, as webGL doesn't perform as well as native apps
- Mobile optimization remains challenging for creators

## Upcoming Features

- VR interaction for the new screenshare feature
- Gamepad API support
- Java support for an unspecified tool/technology
- "E" button functionality and jump controls for mobile
- VRM model changing on mobile
